reviews_data.review_text: It's a cozy place to hang out and grab a cup of coffee. The Oreo Cream Cheese and Pecan Croissant are my favorites, although I usually get my desserts to take away but this place is nice to stay and chat.

I clearly asked for a CHOCOLATE mousse, not a vanilla one. (I came 7/25/24 at 9:15am, if you want to tell the young guy with dark hair that took my order to get his ears checked). I absolutely hate vanilla. I tried it, and it tasted very fake, barely masking the hydrogenated soy bean oil in it. I tried a bit on the top, and it was so gross that I just threw it away. We ordered in, and my drink came in a to go cup, and my friend's came in an actual glass. There goes getting any actual cute photos. Make up your mind. My friend ordered a hot chocolate, which wasn't bad, albeit plain all things considered. My chai latte was gross. It had almost no spices in it, which is why I suspect they put a ton of cinnamon on top, to try and mask this. It basically just tasted of steamed milk, which is freaking gross. I live in a pretty small city, and there is WAY better chai lattes there than this place. Waste of money.

Also, do something about the ants on your patio that are eating your customers when they sit outside.
I tried the Napoleon cake, it was not bad. Definitely one time try

Always have a lovely experience at this shop. Super friendly and nice staff and always clean. Well decorated and light up for just a perfect start to your morning eating a macaroon while sipping on coffee. Enjoy and cheers!!
Greedy, avaricious owners charging $0.50 cents for tap water.

Why did your Cafe begin to charge for water? I am not going to pay extra for a 12 Oz cup of water especially as they used to have it available for free. Seems like they may have some management/financial issue behind the scenes...Sad that a respected restaurant would do this.
More expensive on their desserts than I usually pay....very good though
Pastries are so delicious
Amelie's is my favorite coffee shop and bakery in the area. Their espresso is really good. The macaroons are . Don't sleep on the salted caramel brownies either.

The cappuccino and pastries were good.  However, there was a swarm of flies inside the glass where the sweets were located.  This was pointed out to an employee who responded "I know".   We also noted the crescent rolls that were sitting out were combined with the fresh.  Seeing this was quite disappointing.

This is a nice little place around Pineville. If you are looking for coffee date or just wanted to try some good coffee and other French treats then this is the place for you. Baked Almond croissant was so good, you should not miss that. Macaroons
were also delicious. This place has really nice inside and outside seating with good Atmosphere. Need to go back and try some more items. Overall 4.25/5

20240528: Amelie's has wonderful pastries, coffee, and French bistro food. I like the macarons and coisants with cafe au lait.

For my birthday, Amelie's sent me a $5 birthday coupon, which covered most of the cost of this wonderful macaron and decaf coffee.
Horrible place the employees flirt with customers and sleep with married men Christopher is disgusting at this location don't take your men there
The food and sweets are great! Went there on a rainy day and the concrete floor was a bit slippery from the water. You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table.
Very nice people, great food, reasonable prices! Loved it

Update (5/10/24) to old review. I ordered one of my favorite desserts "Fresh Fruits Tart". I have had this tart many times, but today it was gravely different "water down, lighter color, and nasty taste." What happened to my favorite desserts!   See picture -- changes to a perfect dessert is never good!

Lower rating required for messing up my dessert.
Good coffee and  dessert.Too often there is a broken coffee machine and therefore no coffee .
The atmosphere takes you to a quaint little corner of France. The pastries are delightful and delicious.
Love the pastry here even though it is a bit pricey.  Wish there was one nearer to me.

The kid who delivered our food, his name is Joey. He was so pleasant & asked us what else we needed.
In this day where service sucks everywhere it was was awesome to have a smiling face like Joey's
Great quality foods ,fresh,friendly staff. Atmosphere 100 %
There were multiple gnats in the display case and something fuzzy stuck to my eclair. I usually have no complaints with Amelie's but I'm a bit put off after today. Always a great atmosphere, though

One slice of roast beef and one be slice of cheese cold for $12, tomato soup has the worst taste, broccoli soup is all water, coffee tasted so old and just gross.  $30 for total garbage.  Service was delightful which was lovely.
The best service aver. The food is amazing I had Zahra took my order she is so professional and very knowledgeable and helpful.

The coffee was horrible. The person who makes it needs to know that it can't be so strong that we can't drink without diluting it with water. Unfortunately they didn't keep hot water but it was cold and we ended up with cold coffee.
Wonderful pastries and coffees! Great selection of other drinks, teas and food.
First time coming on a late evening and the hot chocolate and pastries were delicious! It wasn't too busy. Nicely decorated too.

My experience:

Ambience is pretty nice, service is great.

Food and drinks - not great.

1. I ordered light roast coffee - it's bitter than the dark roast.

2. Brownie tart(?) Is hard, I expected a brownie to be soft, but it was hard - but the representative helped me reace with the espresso one. It's tasty.

Eclair is nice.
Everything here is delicious  I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy!
Not sure why this amelies location is charging $5 for lettuce, tomato and basic toppings that come on a sandwich, but these items cost almost the cost of the sandwich itself!
This place is awesome for a snack or meal anytime.
Inconsistent food, inconsistent service, decent pastries and baked goods. It's better than a Starbucks if you don't mind waiting an hour for pickup orders

The pastries and sandwiches might be a little bit on the expensive side but they are always delicious. Everything here looks great and tastes fantastic. It's a great place to meet a friend for coffee and a chat.

Interesting eclectic place. Polite service. Came in for macaroons but ended up with the caramel brownie torte. SO Good. Got a light roast coffee to cut the rich dessert...it was stronger than I was expecting but overall I enjoyed my visit
Such a cozy place to have a breakfast

The dessert is always great, food is back to being great also. Their soups are amazing.

Some items are overpriced.
Loved everything

Used to be my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! The service has totally plummeted at the pineville location over the last year.
Food & coffee is of course still pretty good - but you're typically greeted by unhappy/annoyed staff. Doesn't have the same pleasant vibes anymore. Left the last several times disappointed.

Edit: We love the birthday cakes here! Tge tuxedo cake is our absolute favourite.

The store manager was very receptive and helpful in resolving the mixup described below and expedited a new cake for us on the house.

I placed an order online using Toast - the recommended service - and they gave the WRONG cake (even though we called ahead to check if it was prepared)! We ordered a chocolate cake (tuxedo) but were given a vanilla salted caramel cake. We are all so disappointed when we checked at home. We really enjoyed the chocolate cake the last time we got it and were looking forward to it.

What a great place to stop by for a quick coffee and French bakery. The bakery is always fresh out-of-the-oven. The seating and the ambience is perfect whether it is for somebody doing stuff on their laptops or people chatting. The foods I would say are reasonably priced and offer a great selection. Highly recommended.

Very disappointed with the customer service. We drove all the way from Waxhaw & reached here at 5:29pm on a Sunday and they said it's closed. The sign says open and the usual Sunday hours are till 6pm. Requested if we could just get a coffee and we were denied saying they shut off all the machines since they scheduled a training at 6:15pm
Why schedule something so close to business hours? Why couldn't they operate until 6 and then do the training. Whats the point of having business hours at all

I had quiche which was dry and over baked.  The soup was awful( spinach, asparagus, leek.)  I have ordered this soup probably 20 times at the Park Rd store and once before here.  It was just a big glob of mush. No flavor, very little broth.  Spent $25 and was so disappointed.  After 4 year of going frequently -won't return.

Very cool spot ! Loads of
Fresh quality food and drinks. Well staffed and fun place to dine

Food is amazing, atmosphere and decorations is above excellent. You must go and try.
One of the best in the area
Great place for coffee and pastries. They do an excellent job in making fresh cream.
Love this place! It is so cool and the food is wonderful. Try the coffees and macarons!

Stopped by for a quick bite. The ambiance had a modern layout with plenty of seatings. A cute place to catch up with a friend or get some work done. We ordered a regular croissant, chocolate croissant and a cheese danish. They were all  pretty good- fresh and flaky. We also ordered a bunch of other pastries and macarons to go. Surprisingly the macarons were not overly sweet. Pay attention to your receipt because we got over charged for a few items that we didn't order for.

I was in the area for our Christmas , Honey Baked Ham and saw Amalies. I bought chocolate croissant. Creme brulee, strawberry gateau, salted caramel brownie, lemon raspberry tart, eclair, mini fruit tart, mini pecan pie, and assorted macaroons. Amalies did not disappoint! We cut everything into 1/4's and enjoyed Every bite! Thank you!!!
Salted Caramel Brownie!! Do I need to say more! Unfortunately the hot chocolate we ordered was lukewarm at best. If you like HOT chocolate I'd suggest ordering it extra hot.

It has been years since we have been here.  We stopped in today for a coffee and a yummy pastry.  Everything looked so delicious that it was hard to pick just one.  3 coffee's and 3 treats cost $40, so a little pricey but worth the visit.

Great selection of sweets and pastries, I do think it's a bit pricey, bacon egg and cheese on a croissant for $13 it's totally NY prices. Overall good experience, the atmosphere it's more elderly and family oriented. The decor is unique and very intentional.

I always get a twice baked almond croissant from Amelie's in Noda and it's delicious. I got the same croissant from this location though, and it was very stale. It tasted like it was made at least 2 days ago and has been sitting out. I think it cost about $6, and for that money, I expect a fresh and flaky pastry so I won't be returning to this location.

Delicious food, amazing pastries, excellent environment, very friendly and professional servers... but I find it unbelievable that they have let the cappuccino machine be down for such a long time and not have a replacement. Great place, poor management to allow such a critical machine to be down for so long!
Great French place, great atmosphere and coffee..

Always love Amelie's pastry and eclairs . Ordered Mosier croquettes croissant. Was good but did have a little too much mayo, though. Tried ham vegetable soup and that was okay. Disappointed their espresso machine was down. Service in their was very fast and efficient.
Delicious!! I would like if it were possible to improve the dust cleaning inside the restaurant, because there are too many cobwebs or perhaps it is like this to look more real to France?
Bre took great care of us at the counter. I love going to this location for meetings or lunch after church! It's on of my faves.
Wonderful cafe, interesting interior, very tasty cappuccino, very fresh pastries. My friend and I were very satisfied. We'll be back.
The staff is always super kind and welcoming. Addy at the register was very friendly.
Always so cute and cozy! Love their coffee and the atmosphere!

My cappuccino was fantastic as always.  The atmosphere is vibrant and full. Bre was amazing and cheerful.  I love conversations with those in the hospitality industry after spending 19 years in it myself. Visit Amelie's for the service, atmosphere, food, drinks and experience.  It's worth it.
Bre was so friendly and helpful!!
Bre was very helpful!
Bre was my counter server, and she was professional, friendly, helpful. Great smile!
Yummmm!
It was my first time and it was wonderful! Thanks Autumn!
Amelie's is always great and I make a point to stop when I'm in town. The pastries are fresh and the lavender latte is delicious! Bre was very helpful during my last visit!
nice place, like Khris she makes my day !!!
Khris is awesome she makes best coffee
Bre good :)
Bre was very kind and made me a wonderful drink.

Been coming here for years and love it every time! Great coffee, great vibe and excellence service!

Bree was fantastic!
Julie was very helpful! So many great choices and she was so patient!
Bought an ice coffee...asked for Fresh Cold Brew but they didn't have it. They offered me "canned cold brew"?.. Anyway, Ice coffee wad good. Julie was my cashier.
Julie :)
Khris, is very the best at Amelie's! Gino
Julie is awesome!
Julie was so great!
Excellent staff and amazing service, especially Bre!!
Bre is great
Bre
Bre was great!
Great customer service with great pastries from Julie today.
I love this place, the staff is awesome especially bre!
I always love eating here! Food, coffee, pastries are all great!
Julie was great with service
Bre was very attentive and helpful, excellent service
Friendly service and wait staff - quick and delicious!
Great service and food!  Bre is terrific!
Bree was very nice and gave great service.
Julie was amazing
Bre was awesome and so helpful!!
Bre was amazing and she's so sweet! love her
Bre was great!
Bre was super sweet!! Very good pastries :)
Bre
Pastries are excellent. The "make your own" breakfast sandwich are excellent as well. Bre was kind and considerate helping me use my reward point for a pastery.
Bre was excellent in handling my special requests

Love this location! They have coloring sheets for the kiddos and kids meals which include a macaron. Bre was super helpful and patient while my daughter tried to find which macaron she wanted. We love coming to Amelie's!
bre was so amazing for us!
Wonderful food and Juile was amazing!
Julie was awesome!  Very friendly and helpful
Julie was extremely kind while taking my order.
Love the pastries and the quick service (thank you Julie!).

Love this little coffee and pastry shop! The employees are always so fun and friendly and I really appreciate that the company celebrates individuality and diversity in the workplace. Most will tell you that you have to get the salted caramel brownie here... but I disagree. Go for the palmier or a macaron! Or several.
I have never had a better experience at another Amelies! All the employees are great especially one named razan really made my experience so much better. She offered the best stuff!
Love the food and the cafe overall! The employees are so helpful especially Razan.
Khris is phenomenal out there. Love the ambiance and the coffees
Me coffee was delicious
Bre was very helpful in ordering and service was great!  Will definitely be back.
The veggie quiche and side salad were amazing!  Brie's customer service and warm welcome was great. Highly recommend stopping in.
I had an amazing customer service with Bre! She was very helpful and full of energy!
Bre did a great job'n
Ambiance is very cute and aesthetic good service from Bre.
Bre was great!

I had the pleasure of working with Julie P today.  Julie was pleasant, allowed me to take my time, and still was prompt.   Awesome service!!!  Love the overall atmosphere of this location.  My Latte was still piping hot when I got home.

Great service, great food, great atmosphere!
Bre was friendly and very helpful.
Delicious food and Bre was great!
Food was delicious! Bre was great and super helpful!
Julie was very helpful! Great experience!
Bre and Julie very friendly and courteous. Pastries delightful. We want them all! Great mug of mocha and latte!

I love this Amelies!  The service today with Bre was awesome.  She's so sweet and helpful.  I ordered a blueberry muffin and a salted Carmel mocha!  Delicious as always.  My favorite place to come in the area.  Highly recommend for any delicious pastries coffee or sandwiches.  And the reward program is amazing.  I seem to always be rewarded with dollars off when I come in again.
I look forward to seeing Khris every morning! She is an absolute delight, and makes very good coffee!!
Great service! Bre is so friendly and helpful!
I love coming here almost daily. Khris is always very attentive and polite. Highly recommended. And I love their music.
Bre is awesome

Food is delicious and on nice days we really enjoy the outdoor seating.  We always receive prompt and wonderful service.
Fia and Autumn always greet us with a smile and are very professional and courteous.
Thank you Amelie's Bakery!

Fia and Autumn were awesome and just fun. So personable.

The food was delicious... My sandwich didn't have the jalapeno spread on it, but they were so sweet when advised. I shared some soup too, the tomato basil, and it was excellent by itself and with my sandwich.

The red velvet macaroon was also fantastic.

Definitely will return!

Thanks Fian and Autumn.
Lovely service from Fia and Autumn! Plus, the delicious food and charming atmosphere and aesthetic is hard to beat.
Great place for coffee and a pastry. Service was quick. Autumn and Fia were very personable.  Thanks!

I often visit my daughter in Charlotte, and we come here EVERY time, sometimes multiple times per visit.  It's wonderful every single time.  The food is incredible.  The service is friendly.  This local bakery and cafe is just delightful and a MUST visit.  Today we had Autumn, she was wonderful!
Autumn is the best!
Fia and Autumn greeted me at the counter with positive energy and answered my millions of questions.  Drinks were great.  Food was great.
Autumn and Fia are a delight! The macarons and blueberry muffins were really good! The decorations were really cool too!!
Autumn and Fia is very awesome. Amazing service and atmosphere. Will come again.
Love, love love this place! Autumn was so great!
Autumn was so friendly and helpful!

We had an exceptional experience here. It was made particularly excellent by Holly, who was courteous, quick, and knowledgeable. Holly is a wonderful young person who contributed to a pleasant and effortless dining experience!
Holly is the GOAT. Love them, love their work ethic, love their customer service skills! Pay them more!
Holly is the best manager ever. She is beauty, and grace, and I shoved that mf'in pastry in my face.
Fia is a great employee very hard working and very kind to her customers!

I come here most weeks to work and have a great experience every time! The food, drinks and service is always great. The environment gets my creative juices flowing to get my work done (coffee helps here too).

All of the staff are so kind, especially Fia!! I always have the most uplifting conversations with them. Yummy food and fantastic environment to be in!! My favorite item is the (gluten free) caramel brownie. Such a delightful treat!
Great atmosphere, great food and drinks. Shout to Fia for excellent service and providing a welcoming environment! Will be returning.
Amelie's has always been my go-to place for a  quality coffee. Had a fabulous afternoon coffee and pastry with Fia!

This was my first time going here. I didn't know what to expect. I placed an order and received help from Khris. She was very helpful, patient, and knowledgeable. Made the experience welcoming and memorable. Service and an atmosphere like this will make me come back. Thank you.
Khris is amazing worker. Only coming for her
Really love this new place I discovered. Kris was very kind at the bar and made the nest latte around.
I love the coffee and the pastries. And Khris is the best. She was so nice and i will go back because of her.
I really like this place, it's very cozy and khris is the best and friendliest
Khris is amazing! She is so nice and inviting every time I come

I really enjoy your cafe, and I want to express my gratitude to Khris for her excellent service. She was the best and most welcoming, and her presence made my evening particularly enjoyable. A great establishment with such a wonderful team!

KHRIS IS AN AMAZING SOUL ALL AROUND. HER SMILE, HER KINDNESS, SHE HAS A VERY VERY UPLIFTING PERSONALITY AND SHE CARES SO MUCH ABOUT PLEASING EVERYONE AND MAKING SURE THEY ARENT IN NEED OF ANYTHING. THE WAY SHE INTERACTS WITH HER CO WORKERS IS OUTSTANDING. SHES VERY HELPFUL AND IS ALWAYS AND I MEAN ALWAYS DOING HER BEST TO MAKE SURE EVERYONE AROUND HER IS ALSO DOING THEIR BEST. SHE DEFINITELY BRINGS THE BEST OUT OF EVERYONE AROUND HER.
This place is the best bakery in charlotte and khris was amazing! Pastries are fresh and employees are super friendly. Must try!
Khris was an awesome representative! I will definitely go back!
Awesome place, delicious pastries, Kris was amazing. Definitely will be back.
Khris
Fia was awesome and gave us a very professional and exciting experience and I will definitely be coming back soon!
Khris the server was amazing and extremely friendly, took care of our table real well
Khris was amazing!
Lovely place and a great atmosphere. Kris is super friendly and awesome!
Lovely place, exceptional service, Khris the server is amazing!!
Khris was very helpful with our order!
Amazing food! Khris was so pleasant!

I often work here because of the atmosphere, and I love the food and desserts! Khris, and all of the workers, are very nice and make me feel right at home. If you've never been to Amelie's, come check it out. Great desserts!
The pecan pie was delicious and the service Khris provided was great.

Amazing service, I love their cakes!!!
And our cashier Khris was polite.
great cafe!!! i liked literally everything and our cashier was so friendly, her name is Khris, i recommend!
This is my favourite place ever, I love their cozy atmosphere and cashier Khris provided really great service !
I loved my experience at Amelie's today! Khris did an amazing job helping me out picking the best pastry! Shout out to Khris!!
Yummy soups and deserts riquisimmo
Beautiful.  Amazed at the set up.  Great customer service.  Will come back.
So sad the quality has decreased. This is the second time here in a few weeks and Botha time the food was not fresh. Missed the crispy croissants and macaroons. Not worth it anymore.
Saturday morning. Cold, not fresh (at least a day or more old) pastries - chocolate croissant (should be called a pain au chocolat) and goat cheese Danish.
Mega freundliches Personal und sehr sauber. Ich hatte einen Iced coffee und einen Fresh fruit tart! War mega gut!
No soup and insufficient Staff to support business.   Five order with three mistakes.   You can do better!
All around disappointing experience.  Food wasn't good.  What was served was not fresh.  Part of our large to-go order was left out.  Probably the last time we go back for lunch.
Best Coffee and Pastry shop South side of Charlotte.
I have wanted to try them and the day I came in they no espresso, so no cappuccino, and they offered me iced coffee. So I got tea, nothing special. However, the key lime tart was very good.

Love this place. The twice baked croissant is so delish. And the quiche is so yummy.   this place is definitely a must go to and try. Great friendly staff. Nice and clean and brightly lit. Weather permitting, you can sit outside as well.
The tiramisu is amazing! And the atmosphere and people are welcoming.

An amazing, artistic, classic and calming environment. Amelie's to me will be in my top 5 bakeries/coffee shops/simple lunch or meetup spots. I truly enjoyed the overall atmosphere and vibe. The employees were very nice, and overall I loved it.
Desserts;
I had a few different ones and so did a business partner of mine who I was meeting up with and we enjoyed all of it.
We had
Chocolate Silk Tart 8/10 (no soggy bottom. Perfect. The chocolate custard reminded me of my mothers)
*Tiramisu 8/10 (not dry at all. Perfectly soaked in coffee)
*Creme Brulee 9/10 (they torched it fresh)
*Salted caramel brownie 7/10 (you can tell caramel was cooked properly with how well it held up)
*Banana Cream Tart 7/10 (no soggy bottom. Perfect)
*Cheese Danish 7/10 ( could use more cream cheese but overall very flaky and good taste)

Overall everything wasn't nastily sweet like you get with some american bakeries. Everything you could actually taste what they were made with and not just sugar.

I really enjoyed it. She really enjoyed it. She went to the bathroom and stated they even had a secret code word for woman in case they are in trouble to discreetly tell employees. Very happy with that. Not a lot of places do that. Bathrooms were very clean and nice on the mens side.
I LOVE finding dirty plastic in my salad. Totally gross and choking hazard.
Definitely try their chocolate tart with cream on top. It's just so delicious. I am not a big fan but my girlfriend said she tasted the best macaroons of her life here.
Matthews decor is better in my opinion but cute cafe regardless.

I had fully intended to take a picture of my food along with the store to post. But it was so unbelievably delicious it didn't last more than a minute on my plate. My boyfriend and I shared the chicken-pesto-goat cheese sandwich. Along with a chocolate croissant and a palmier. Everything came out very fast.  The sandwich was fresh and balanced and extremely filling and the pastries were perfectly crispy, flaky and buttery. Everything you want in a pastry. We also got a cappuccino and a latte both were excellently made and tasty. If you're in the area you'd be doing yourself a disservice not to stop by.
Cappuccino and the desserts are delicious

I go to Amelie's on Pineville Matthews Road every Saturday afternoon. They have been out of wine for more than a month now and the manager tells me they will be out of wine for another month. Since I'm not aware of any wine shortage, I find this odd and it was a very good reason for me to turn around and walk out.
Todo es delicioso,es un lugar muy tranquilo y muy bonito

Come check them out! Great place known for their desserts.   They also gave coffee, tea, salads, and sandwiches.   They have plenty of indoor and outdoor space. Meet here with a friend and colleagues or bring your laptop to get work done.

I ordered the CAFE MARCOTTER
vanilla bean, espresso, milk, caramel & overnight oats I added berries & sliced almonds to it. Service was great & my coffee & oats were delicious! Thank you
Enjoyed their macarons. Amazing fruit tarts. Highly recommend for all the sweet tooth out there
Wonderful place to get some sweets and fancy drinks.
Great place, pretty good service, and great desserts.
Good selection  of pastries and desserts. Had good amount of choices in coffee  and flavors. They have many sandwiches to choose from as well as other things on menu.
The new tarts were amazing!

There's a lot to love...relaxing atmosphere and delicious menu at Amelie's (Carmel Commons). Also worth noting is the welcoming staff on both sides of the counter.
In particular I'd like to thank Terri who was so friendly and attentive during our meal, ensuring a great dining experience.
Pastries and good coffee. An evening treat.
Always a great place to go with family when I am in town. The coffee is amazing and I love all the different flavors of macaroons.
Eclectic decor, stupendous lighting. Pleasant atmosphere! Great energy!

I love the vibes of this place. It is so unique and chill. The food and baked goods are also very good, and for gluten free folks or those with celiac they have plenty of options for you too. I went with my mom who has celiac and got her an Oreo/peanut butter dessert and it was delicious!
I got myself a wrap and coffee as well. Both were very good too.
A very cute cafe however my second time and they are all out of chocolate croissants. If that item so high in demand why not make more?
Nice place, good spot to work remotely. Plenty of space.

We have been to various Amelie cafes lots of times.

This time, my favorite petit gateaux with strawberry was not fresh and tasty. It was hard to eat it. It looked like it was in a fridge for several days. The cream was very dense and with almost no taste.

Original petit gateaux was not good as well. It looked like it was from a fridge.

To sum up, Amelie network in general is a great place. This particular one significantly does not meet the franchise quality level.
I enjoyed the desserts.
My blueberry muffin was not even fully cooked.

There is no question about it, you will absolutely be transported to france.
Every single thing is so cool about this place , be in interiors, menu, props, walls every little thing is so full of creative aspects.
Had their latte and chicken pesto sandwich.

There is lot more stuff to try.
Overall loved it.

Update: 6/30/23
I come to this location often, but today I had the pleasure of meeting Cam! I have to say she was so sweet and delivered my chai tea to me and assisted me with all of my needs! I have to say her make up is absolutely gorgeous. It was one of the first things I notice. It's so nice to be greeted by such a lovely personality this early in the morning. Thank you Cam for making my day a little bit more special.

Thanks to my barista lady Marsta (sorry for the misspelling) for making my son and I our favorite drink "Caramel dirty chai" she's always great!
Love their Napoleon, Fresh Fruit tart, and Oreo. I always get the Napoleon along with other new items I've never tried. Love the ambience as well.

Premium prices for frozen pastry?
My Napoleon was frozen. They told me I needed to give it a few minutes to thaw. Why are there frozen pastries here? They supposedly bake fresh goods daily. This tough, soggy pastry and icy filling tell a different story.
That said, the staff was very helpful and friendly, if a little slow.
Always great food, desserts and great service. We love this place for regular days and special events.
This is the best coffee shop I came across in Charlotte!!! Everything tastes so good!!!!
Great place!

They deserve 5* YES no doubt about it.

Cappuccino 10/10
Latte 10/10
Almond Cake 10/10
Avocado toast with eggs Sunny side 10/10

Go for it, best French breakfast cafe in charlotte.
Friendly staff. They offered me a free sample which is great! The treat we bought was delicious

Un lugar recomendado al 101%, la calidad de su pasteleria y sus postres es asombrosa, productos muy bien logrados y con una gran variedad entre opciones dulces y saladas asi como tambien diferentes tipos de bebidas como cafes y la tradicional mimosa que no podia faltar, la atencion es excelente, lo unico que tengo por decir es que el personal es poco pero muy amable, asi que hay que acercarse al mostrador para solicitar cualquier pedido. Volveria mil veces.

If you're looking for a delightful French bakery in town, Amelie's is definitely worth checking out.

First of all, the bakery itself is charming and cozy. The atmosphere is fun, warm and inviting, and the staff is friendly and welcoming. Even though I stopped in at a very busy time, they managed to keep things running smoothly, the cases fully stocked and I never felt rushed.

Now let's talk about the food. Oh my, it was delicious! I tried the macarons, chocolate mousse cups, and a few of their pastries, and they were all fantastic.

To drink, I ordered a strawberry cream soda, which was refreshing, sweet and strawberry creamy goodness!

Overall, I had a wonderful experience at Amelie's French Bakery. The food was top-notch and the service was excellent. If you're looking for a bakery that's both delicious and welcoming, be sure to check out Amelie's.

My coworker and I walked to Amelie's and were helped by such a lovely employee named Fia (Sofia?). They helped us with the BEST attitude and customer service. My experience was so positive because of them! Great environment and will definitely go back because of my enjoyable visit today.

We are regular customers and love this place!  The lattes are wonderful as well as the croissants.  The staff is so friendly.  They greet us always with beautiful smiles!  we highly recommend this bakery/cafe and look forward to each time we go.

I LOVE this place and I come 3 to 4x a week for work and just to relax. I am so so so so upset they stopped making the chocolate eclair. Several customers are actually. It's rare to find an eclair filled with chocolate mousse and I loved coming here foe them. I'd legit order 2 dozen boxes of them a week for home and my job. So disappointed. Meanwhile there are so many pastries that literally no one orders . Ugh please bring it back!
I loved this place
Frech is only the name. Poor food/bakery quality. Poor service. Never to go back.

I was pleasantly surprised that Amelie's actually has a good chicken spinach sandwich that had goat cheese and some sort of basil pesto spread on it. However, overall I feel the quality of the desserts have gone down. Meaning, what's not pictured is a lemon raspberry tart because when I cut into it, it was the consistency of Yellow Grits... Not smooth at all. Therefore, I gave it back and although they admitted it shouldn't be that way they didn't have any fresh ones to swap with because that whole entire batch came from the main store. The soup that came with the sandwich had a decent flavor but it was very mushy, definitely overcooked!

10/10! So delightful!

I enjoyed a Spinch & Pepper tart and minestrone soup. Incredible.
Before I left, I ordered take home of apple tart and almond croissant! Yum!!!

10/10!

Very disappointed, I ordered 2 Chai lattes large size to go today, and when we were at the house ready to drink them, they taste like water , super watery nothing of what a Chai latte is expected to be, I drove 15 mins to go pick up and 15 mins back and just to put them in the sink, very very disappointed and loose of money

Everyone in my group received their food and was eating and my food had not come out yet.  They made it right though, since the stew I wanted was sold out, by reversing my payment back to my card. Then they comp'd another meal and a pastry. They are all so pleasant. Kudos Amelie's, Pineville; Kudos Pam!

I have been coming to Amelie's for close to ten years. Have always enjoyed coming here for a weekend breakfast. But price increases are out of control. On top of it the portion sizes have gotten smaller. Fine if you have to raise costs, but don't screw meet on the food amount. For example the croissants have clearly gotten smaller. Will be coming here far less.
The best french Pastries and Tartines in North Carolina
Amazing and delicious desserts. Huge assortment daily and the Best macaroons in CLT. Coffee is the perfect pairing.
My daughter's favorite lunch and treat spot!
Ameli at is best...

Got to the front of the line and the cashier said "food and drink with me." I ordered a pastry and got loudly berated for not ordering at the right location. Last time I checked pastry are food. As a first time customer this was very inappropriate.

Almond croissant that I took out was dried out. Worst of all management doesn't seem to care about responding to customer bad experience. It's a shame. I used to like going here
Dear Owner, Thanks for your response. I sent a message on your webpage and am awaiting a still response. Not sure how you are expecting me to provide my email privately. Do you really want to make good - it sure doesn't seem like it

Danielle and staff we friendly, helpful and very accommodating!  They went above and beyond to deliver me an vanilla eclair at the end of their day. :)
And my daughter was able to get a birthday treat to help celebrate her special day as well!
We have always loved Amelie's and this is just a few reasons why! Thank you!!!
Great pastries and beverage options

Nice and cozy place to be at.
However, please teach your baristas how to make a cappuccino. It was so terrible I had to throw it away. Super hot, the milk was boiled. A gas station coffee would be 10 times better than this.

It was good before fall 2022. I liked everything about this place. However now it is different:

- no classic commercial grade espresso machine anymore, just a single "automatic" one.

- barista professionalism is questionable: coffee (cappuccino) is very inconsistent, most of the times 8oz cup is filled tops, it is boiling hot that you burn your mouth etc. It tastes more like milk than coffee (too much milk + boiling hot).

- to get an extra shot of espresso (to make it taste more like coffee) you have to pay for a separate Double Espresso (I have to order it separately and after because I never know how bad/good my cappuccino will be this time).

- prices recently skyrocketed. A "large (diameter=3 inches)" pecan tart is now 6.50 before tax. I would (maybe) agree to pay this price if the coffee section/baristas would be making it right and consistent. Still it became very, very expensive.

I did not want to hate it. I just don't understand why should I pay so much for this kind of service (most of my complaints are regarding coffee quality). I know I can find another place but the location of this one is good for me. And it used to be better.
Please take some effort to educate baristas and improve the quality of coffee.
This place was so cute. Their sweets were very delicious. The coffee  was amazing also. We will definitely be coming back

My best friend took me here for my birthday and she definitely made the right choice. She ended up getting four macaroon and I got two and a cookies and cream cup. When I tell you when both collectively said mmmm after biting into those macaroons would be a understatement. Those desserts were so good

I don't get why this palace has lots of stars. I had their products on multiple occasions and I was not impressed. Their macarons were not delicious at all, they were on hard side when I got them. I gave it another chance and got eclairs and half of the shell was empty. Today we got their lunch sandwiches and fruit tart. Lunch sandwiches are way over priced for what they have. They did not offer refill for my iced tea and fruit tart was average. On top of that their ambiance is not very "calm, relax or charming" it is more like chaos. They have some many pieces that does not match. Not my favorite. After many tries I think today was the last one. Will be looking for better bakeries around the town.

It's always a delicious experience at Amelie's! Love this location for It's spaciousness, friendly staff and fresh pastries! The coffee options are also amazing and I've never been disappointed! Defintiely one of my go-to spots in south Charlotte!

This place was terrible.  We orderd 2 sandwiches off the menu and ordered it to go. It was Martin Luther King day so they were busy but the wait for our to go order took over 30 minutes. We had to leave for an appointment so we left without getting our food. They did refund our mo ey for the food but it was frustrating nonetheless. We never did try the food and probably never will. The staff we talked to about it were rude and blamed the backup on the kitchen staff. My girlfriend ordered a small tea and the tea was large but very weak. She asked for another tea bag and an employee took her over to the area where the tea bags were at the end of the bar and told her to pick out the tea she wanted, she even told her to try a couple different ones which was kind but then the guy making the coffee and drinks who said he was a manager told her "Hey, what are you doing, you cant just take those." She explained to him that his employee told her to select a few and he said "So.your just going to take them and walk out of here with them?" and her reply was "Yep!".

We were served in plastic cups even though we dined on site. Double espresso  is far from being double and smells bad in a plastic cup. On top of all aggressive attitude when we asked to change cups. This is far from being french attitude

What an awesome French bakery. We enjoyed lunch and dessert here. We had been looking for creme brulee locally
and my goodness how creamy and delicious. We also tried their fruit tart which were just as amazing with the creamy almond center. The ambience and decoration was great. Lunch was delicious and tasted so fresh. We will definitely be back! Yes there seemed to be a line the whole time we were there (Saturday around noon) but so worth it.
Love the tartine with bacon, brie, and fig jam! Also, the ice tea with lavender syrup. Really tasty food and desserts.

On the way back to Soda City, my beautiful Daughter in Law asked if there were any French Bakeries nearby. (She speaks fluent French) So I whooped out my brain, iPhone, and did an extensive research. I came up with Amelies French Bakery that had a location near us and several others in Charlotte. I GPS'd to their Carmel location and put the emergency blinkers on as I waited outside while the crew were inside filling up boxes. When they came, I took pictures that looked pretty good. Little did I know my tongue hitting my head may cause a concussion when I took a taste of the first sample and I thought I was in France as they were so good!!! If you are looking for sickening sweet desserts, this is not for you. If you like European sweetness, Soda City can't compete!!! I knew something was up as I saw so many people coming out with boxes!!! The only error was my Son told them not to torch the top of his cream brulee. He said he wouldn't turn it down again.

One of my favorite places plus i have beautiful memories over there, pastry and mini tarts look beautiful and they are delicious, cozy atmosphere, I wish for this place to never go away and Open more locations around Charlotte.
Delicious quiche, flavorful fruit tart and my favorite, blackberry sweet tea. Decore is French-themed, loved all the chandeliers. Staff was friendly.

Amelie's French bakery, this is one of the most popular bakery in Charlotte, every time I come here always a line, my favorite is the macaroons! Not too sweet and very soft. Love the spacious seating area. Bring a friend and enjoy your French style morning!

I really love Amelie's because of the funky vibe, and the food is decent. But ugh the staff. They're nice, but they never listen to you. Here's a typical order for me:

Hi! What can I get for you?

Large oat milk hot latte, please!

Anything else?

No, thank you.

OK, regular hot latte. Is that for here or to go?

Umm, no. Large, please. And oat milk. And it's for here. Mug, please.

Gotcha! Can I get a name?

Christopher.

Right. Anything else?

Umm...no, thank you [again].

Got it!

And what was the name for that order?

Christopher. 

Five minutes later: "Latte for Chris!" (and of course it's in a to go cup).



It's like this more times than it's not.

Train your staff to LISTEN. It's so disrespectful.

Great coffee, sandwiches & pastries. The only caviat is I was there when it was very busy...they made my coffee while I was at the register completing my payment...ny the time I picked it up-it had cooled off too much.  When my sandwich came to the table it was only semi-warm. Everythimg was delicious.
i've been coming here for years! it's a beautiful and unique place. today i tried a s'mores entremet and was stunned by how good it was! they have various pastries and also a coffee and wine bar!
It's the best place in all of Charlotte
Great pastries and coffee!
Uiutnoe mesto ,vkusnoe kapuchino . Est' ochen' vkusnye pirozhnye.

I liked the food here and it is pretty cool inside to be honest. Also the lady at the counter did everything possible to help us  with our order since we were here for the first time. I didn't give five stars only because we did wait 25 minutes for our order to be done and it was served in paper bowls and plastic containers - I'm not sure they always do that

I am speechless.  For years Amelie's was THE place to get a great baguette.  I would buy 10 at a time since I live a long way from  the closest store.
I was close by yesterday and had some friends coming to breakfast today so I drove to the store and bought one so I could serve something special.
Baguette now is almost like plain white loaf bread made in the shape of a baguette.  Only special as to how disappointing to see how ordinary it is.
LaBrea baguettes at HT much better, Bobby Boy Bakeshop in Winston Salem are the best I've tasted on this side of the Atlantic.
Amelie, bring back the old baguette.
The french dip was very good.
A good advise: when you get a to-go order for 2 or more different drinks, please mark or label them all the time.
Great ambiance and plenty of comfortable seating. Good coffee and food options too!

Great place yo grab coffee and meet.  Update 11/06/22. Today I had a coffee with a good friend around 10am.  We both decided to use the bathroom before we left the place.  Well, let me tell you: we saw an employee walk in do #1, #2, and n#3. She came out after us.  My friend and I were using each one a sink to wash out hands.  This girl wasn't happy she had to wait, so she just grabbed a paper towel to clean her hands dry; no water no soap,no sanitizer.  We ran out of the bathroom after her to see what was she will do.  To our surprise she went back to  rolling and cutting dough without gloves and no washing her hands.  This is totally unacceptable.  If you work in a restaurant take your time to wash your hands. Specifically if you are touching the food I am going to eat. Else, quit your job if you don't like it.

This is a great cafe! The mocha latte was perfect. It seems they may be using a bakery chocolate. It had a velvety smooth mouth feel and stayed mixed to the end. Not too sweet and it let the coffee shine through. The macrons are really tasty with a variety of flavors. A slightly resistant outer crust with a delightful soft chew to the interior. And the cream is delicious. Not inexpensive by any means, but true to the old saying, "you get what you pay for." Highly recommended!
Eclectic adorable coffee shop. Delicious pastries and coffee.
Beautiful place.

I visit this location of Amelie"s about once a month. Having lived in Bordeaux some years ago as an expatriot, I miss the French pasteries from time to time, and Amelie's satisfies that longing.  On this visit, my order was a few specialties for take home which included the plain croissants (authentic in my view!), eclairs, lemon macarons, and a chocolate mousse (fluffy and tastful).
Ordering has been streamlined - on reaching the head of the line, there is an associate there at all times to take your order at left of the counter. If you are ordering pastries to go, another associate works with you to complete your order.
The wait was short at 5 min considering there were 12 people in line and it was a busy Sunday. Service was friendly and attentive.
In a future visit, plans are to dine here which can be indoors or on the covered patio on the right side of the cafe.
Best bakery in Charlotte metro area

The quality of the food isn't what it used to be. My wife and I always come to Amelies for brunch and a some homework (we're both full time students), and I always order the same thing. A classic French dip. Every time I come, my French dip is ice cold in the middle. I always have to ask them to heat it. I'll even ask them when I place the order to please make sure that is heated all the way through. It still comes out cold. Last time I was here, the manager was nice enough to replace my meal and refunded the French dip. I came back again and still the same cold sandwich. I didn't say anything this time because what's the point? I dont want my money back, just some hot food. I'll just have to take the extra couple of minutes and drive to the Noda location.

I really enjoy coming to this place. I come here every Saturday morning for a great cappuccino, a mini chocolate mousse cup, and a nice breakfast.  The staff are all friendly, and the place is always clean.  I definitely recommend this place for good coffee and good eats.

I love their food but the birthday cake I picked up yesterday was a big disappointment. It was a chocolate Tuxedo cake, but it was very dry. Also, it didn't have ganache or mousse on the inside--just frosted between layers with the same frosting. There were no chocolate curls, instead little mini chocolate chips which kept rolling of the plate.  I've had good cakes from this location before, so I expected a lot more. It needed the mousse to offset the bitter dark chocolate taste. It crumbled when cut into. NO one finished their piece. Sad.
Great French bakery and cafe, Love the ambience.

I wrote a good review last year, but I have to agree with another reviewer who said that the offerings and quality on some of the bakery items have dwindled.  Like her,  I also visited about three months ago, and a few times since then, and the cases were practically empty.  I asked the employee if they sold out because of the holiday.  I was told that they were in the process of hiring three more bakers.  Lately, the cases seem to have a few more items than in the recent past.  It's not uncommon for me to take home an Amelie's shopping bag filled with boxes of pastries. However, the last two times I purchased the Strawberry Petit Gateaux, there was no cream filling!  The chantilly cream is the best part, but it was cake on top of cake!  TWICE!!! And I have to mention that the first time, the cake was dry.  Also, although the Mirror tart is delicious, it used to be so pretty with the swirl of chocolate ganache on top.  Now, the ganache is just spread on top and looks very plain.  I had lunch with my son there also, and we were both looking forward to having the Asparagus and Leek soup.  I told my son that it looked like they forgot to add the cream, and there was no flavor, as if they added unsalted broth and forgot the seasonings. The sandwiches on the croissants were good, though.  I have great memories of visiting the Flagship store in NoDa. That's where I was introduced to all the good food and pastries. The Carmel Commons location is closer to home for now.  I hope they can replicate the quality of the flagship store one day!
Awesome coffee and pastries
Strawberry Cheesecake Tart
I've been to the Carmel Rd location three times. The food is great but the coffee has always been lukewarm even before my adding milk. If i go back, I will return the coffee.

Very nice French bakery with tons of yummy cakes and meals! They are opening new locations often and all have really lovely ambiance!! Feels like Alice in Wonderland in Paris! Also have a rewards system if you sign up with your phone number or email, it helps especially for people out of town that may buy more than one thing per person like us.
Un lugar cautivador, es como sentir la magia de Europa aqui.Los empleados muy amables y sonrientes siempre, sin duda uno de mis lugares favoritos en Charlotte . Toda la comida deliciosa .
Always the best coffee (and pastries )

This was our first time visiting. We enjoyed the ambiance of the establishment and the pastries, for the most part. The petit strawberry shortcake was delicious, but the cinnamon buns were extremely dry and we could not eat them. We will try microwaving later on. Thank you!

Their pastires are really small for the price, and some of them like the eclairs are overcooked. They close to early, the should stay open on the weekday until at least 10. There's no where to hang out in Pineville where it's not a bar environment.
But other thank that, the place is great. Love going there for our meetings, meet-ups.  Occasional sweet tooth. Just to get out of the house and relax. I wish they would have installed some sound proof panels or something, it gets loud when it's packed. I like going there when it's quieter.  Love their loose leaf tea options. Hard to find good tea around here if it's not a tea shop.

Camden was AMAZING! Her customer service skills are phenomenal! She took the time to answer  ALL my questions and made sure I was very happy with my selections. 10 out 10, will highly recommend!!!! I will be a repeat customer because of her. This was my first experience trying this bakery and I am so very glad I did!

Any chance I get to meet someone for coffee in South Charlotte, Amelie's is my go-to! I could ooh and ahh over all the gorgeous pasties and treats in the displays forever. I try to select something new each time and ALWAYS end up taking something home. It's such a fun experience!
I LOVE this place! High ceiling, plenty of space, funky, French inspired decor, perfect for peaceful work or casual chat... and amazing macarons.. je suis au paradis!

3rd time i have gone in and been disappointed.  1st time the case was barely full of any food in the afternoon and sandwich was cold. 2nd time waited 45 minutes for an unheated baguette, full kitchen staff and only 6 customers in the store at the time until a manager noticed that we had been waiting for a long time. And 3rd time this morning where i asked 3 girls at the registers if they could break big bills and was told yes, they took the money and then i had to wait  15 for a manager to get change and then was told  by the manager that they dont accept big bills until after lunchtime which doesnt cater to early bird customers. Unfortunately i wanted to make this a daily stop in the mornings but now i will not be stopping in at the location again.

Beautiful place. Wonderful atmosphere. Not for the gluten sensitive. Great croissants and a large selection of tarts and macaroons. Would recommend definitely, but not if you have a tree nut or gluten allergy. The options are very limited for the tree nuts as most of the dessert options have almonds in them. The food is delicious. Go there for a splurge. Unique and wonderful layout.
Had coffee and an almond croissant from here this morning. Quick service, fair prices, delicious food - can easily recommend! Check them out.
No  vi variedad de postres, no se si es por falta de materia prima o de personal
It doesn't matter when you come, there is nothing. They only make a few options at this location. Never again.
First time visiting this specific location. Nice outdoor covered space.

They were out of about 75% of their Bakery items by 1:00pm on a Sunday. Their explanation was "we no longer have a baker at this location so this is all we can offer". The sandwiches we ordered were great, the $50 cake we pre-ordered and picked up was not. It looked fantastic until we cut into it, and then the whole thing started crumbling to pieces. The "buttercream" frosting was weird and cracked into pieces when we tried to cut it. We had a baker in the family that said they must have made the cake earlier in the week and frozen it (not surprising since they don't have a baker anymore). Not what I'd expect for $50. We won't be back to this location; hopefully they haven't let their other location fall apart like this one.

If you're looking for a nice customer service experience DON'T GO TO THIS LOCATION!
I was so hyped to visit this Amelie's and came in (most tables were dirty with previous customers plates and drinks - see photos) also I got an iced coffee and three desserts. The iced coffee was watered down filled with milk and sugar. I asked to exchange with hot coffee and they refused. How cheap can you be to refuse to exchange a cup or hot tea? And they give you a look like you're stealing from them! Ugh I just left this horrible customer service experience place for a so many different ones. Save your self the trip and check out Night swim coffee or Not Just Coffee or Undercurrent Coffee or summit coffee. There's so many places to try in the Charlotte area

I just edited my review because of the response I have just received.
I have been to the Amalie's on 36th many times and I love the brie bacon fig jam on halved french bread. I mean I adored and it has thick slices of brie on about a 6" slice of bread. BUT I just had it here at the Carmel rd location and it was a 4" slice of bread with jam and bacon. I took it back up and told them that it had no brie and they told me it was a brie spread which equals no brie. Very disappointed
Years ago I used to go to the Amelie's and NoDa and study and take my daughter and she would do her homework and it just brought back so many memories to the one on Pineville Matthews Road the best

I've always enjoyed this location but the quality of service has dwindled. I came around 10 am thinking that there would be no problem dealing with the desserts being sold out. When I got there , there was barely anything in the actual coolers and the lady said that she didn't know when there will be. It's very unprofessional especially for it to be so early in the day on a week day. Very disappointed.

The service at this location is OK. The food is consistent with the other locations. However, it can get crowded which slows down things a bit. They run out of things quickly but they don't tell you until after you've paid & the manager  (short man) isn't very accommodating because of this issue...
If you're looking for a great place to enjoy coffee, great food and service - Amelie's is the best.
Relaxed atmosphere, spacious indoor and patio seating. Berry salad and chicken salad croissant was delish and fresh macaroons.
Very good lunch and of course the macaroons were DELICIOUS !!!!!!
One of the Best coffee shops in US!
Great coffee and macaroons!

Bad and rude service... the gentlemen that attended us was pushy and after a thank you without deserving it? Not even a polite smile out of him. I believe that the service in Charlotte it's getting worse and worse with time. Absolutely no manners and I'm a Latin woman where I saw that the previous customers where treated nicely

Very rude guy attending us, i came with my wife and sister in law, we are hispanic and there where three people in front of us and where treated nicely and polite and as soon as it was our turn, his semblance completely changed and he was rude and pushy... i wonder why?
The desserts can be better
The flavor of the chicken sandwich I ordered was great but the chicken was a bit dry and tough.  Didn't seem super busy yet takes longer than expected to receive your order.
Perfect, but get there esrly
Not that big siting as the NODA one or the downtown Amelies. But, the owner looks to be friendly and their is no difference in taste compared to other two locations. Love their macrons

Never have I seen such a display of absolute incompetence than at Amelie's.  20+ minutes and I finally had to ask for a refund, because my food was no where in sight.  5-6 employees and 1 other customer besides myself and these nit-wits couldn't figure out how to put a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich together in under 20 freakin minutes.  No apology, no remorse, just failure.

I've always liked this Amelie's uptown and this location. We ordered macaroons,  almond cake thing, coconut macaroons as well. I liked em but they did taste a bit dry from the inside. I liked the assorted chandeliers and the decor of this French bakery. They make stuff in house.
Great place for bakery items and coffee. Very cute decor and excellent service! Highly recommended
Just don't go on a Monday because there wasn't that much of a selection of baked goodies. Maybe next time!
Extremely slow service, two drinks took 25 minutes to make, food came out wrong.
Always friendly staff and tasty treats!
A super cute lunch and coffee bakery. They are always busy but the service never falls below exceptional.

French bakery.   Try the Breakfast sandwich.

Edit:  I have to change my review.  I was in today and after 25 minutes I asked them to check into my order. After 35 minutes they brought me the wrong order.  After 45 minutes they said they would refund the sandwich and bring it anyway.  After 55 minutes I walked across the parking lot and ate at McDonalds.  They never credited a refund so I reported the transaction  to my Apple credit card.   Apple was the only one with good service today. :)
Great pastries and sandwiches
Definitely a good spot for a coffee and pastries.
Very nice.  Great pastries and cookies
So warmth service and great staff! Pastries (especially Almond Croissant) and Hot Chocolate are great!!
Bakeries are so good, sweet enough to enlighten the taste and moods but took forever for just a bread & coffee.
Cool atmosphere and delicious everything.

While my order was to-go, they were kind and gentle. The cafe macotter was delicious and the macarons are the perfect amount of sweet and flavor. There's a cute sitting area outside which I will for sure visit when the weather and covid permits.
delicious food, accommodating menu, and beautiful/clean interior! lovely quirky place

Unique style and very European feel if you want to have your pastry and stay.  Wide variety of options and nice prices. Maybe too much space devoted for seating that is not used at the moment but overall a nice experience.
They gave me a burnt croissant i didnt ask for. Completely wrong order after waiting 20 mins for a to go.
Terrific customer service.  Excellent selection.  Wonderful atmosphere.  Very clean and well stocked.
Excellent food

I know the food is good, but today they got me sitting here 30 minutes to get my food as I watch person after person leave that came way after me. Service isn't very good today with absolutely no explanation.
Great.
Excellent choices, exceptional menu and good service.

Lately they often do not have basic meats available for sandwiches like turkey or ham which is very strange.  It will be 12:30 and no deli meat ??  Go to a grocery store! Usually their food is great but the past month I have had to leave with nothing.
Great bakery. petit gateaux are not petit. I hope they know Oh La La means oh no
The chicken salad croissant was ok. The sticky bun was delish! Service was good.
Love love love this place. Clean, staff is friendly and well versed in the menu and daily items, and they get stuff out in a timely fashion. I love this cafe and bring friends and family regularly!
I ordered a breakfast sandwich and they left the egg off, and added the bare minimum of onion and cheese. Total joke

I'm a longtime Amelie's customer. I've been supporting them since 2005 or so. My favorite things to get are:
- macarons
- salted caramel brownies
- apple turnovers
- cinnamon twists
- breakfast sandwich on a croissant
- fig, bacon, brie open-faced sandwich
- quiche of the day
- chai lattes
- the seasonal lemonade
Always a great place for some French food and to hang out with friends! Top notch pastries. You can't beat their flakey and buttery croissants
Nice place,food,dessert,cappuccino very good and delicious. I enjoyed very much
We work nearby and love grabbing coffee and a pastry at Amelies.  Such a great environment and always friendly staff!

We stopped into Amelie's for a quick stop before going to take out little pup for a walk. The bakery had a large selection with tons of macrons and other classic deserts such as eclairs. I ordered a Napoleon, one of my favorite dessert. I will say that it was hard to cut/eat but the flavor was spot on. They used a more marscapon filling, though I always prefer pastry cream. We also got some croissant sandwiches. The coffee was okay but the cappuccino I ordered was one of the better ones I have had

Delicious and much more than a bakery. They offer a large selection of cakes, cupcakes, cookies, pastries and more. They also offer a very quaint place to sit and have a light bite to eat. Sooo good, no matter what you choose.

My wife, son, and granddaughters went there for breakfast. My son loved the breakfast sandwich. My granddaughters loved the eclairs and the really crisp bacon. My wife and I had the sausage and cheese quiche. I loved it, my wife said hers was just okay, and it was cold
Lumpy macarons with an oily residue in your mouth.
So glad Amelie's has re-opened

korona sigiyeoseoinji sarami byeolroeobsgo menyudo gadeugcaissjineun anhassda. bbalri korona sanghwangi johajyeoseo yeogijeogi bumbineun gagedeuleul mannagosipda. geureomyeon jinyeoljange bbangdo deoug areumdabgessji...

I contacted via email requesting information about reopening for in dining but i never received any answer back. Even though mask amd other restrictions have been lifted the store remains closed for in dining. Not convenient at all for customers who have been using Amelie's for long time.

**Thank you for taking the time to reply to my comment.
Fresh, tasty Goodness! Simple as that. Will definitely be returning

I have been loyal to Amelies for years and years. Over the last several months, I have had consistently run into issues (wrong order that I can't eat) and attitude that is uncomfortable. I have reached out to customer service to no avail. It saddens me to write this.
Love Amelie's. It's one of our go to places for sandwiches and coffee in Charlotte. Their bakery is amazing!

I stopped in for a little something sweet and I tried the fresh fruit tart, absolutely delicious!  I must say it satisfied my craving !!!!!!
Thank You Amelies
They would still not let people sit down or use the bathroom / wash their hands. It's 2021, not 2020.
The strawberry on the top of my dessert was rotten.Dirty patio.
Open outside.
Excellent.
Not as good as it used to be. My drink didn't taste like it had any lavender simple syrup and the macarons left much to be desired.
Came for the coffee, stayed for the macarons.
Good food
This place is amazing!!  I loved the variety of macarons and pastries!  Everything was fresh and delicious.  Me and my friends loved every bit of it!
Great pastries, and chicken salad
Delicate pastries and tasty sandwiches. Received friendly service and loved everything we tried!
Love it!

Had lunch at Pineville today, and it was delicious...Had not eaten at A's in several years and was happy to see the expanded menu...Safety during CoVid is respected ( bravo) ; ate outside at Noon, and the service was great, and the baguette and soup were outstanding! We will definitely come more often...Great job Amalie's !
Great experience.  Pastries were delicious and servers were helpful and friendly
Excellent French bakery with variety of options, which inhibits decision making and challenges you to limit your purchase.  You just must indulge, everything is delicious!  Don't forget the macarons
Always the best
Fast in service and ordered to go. Well pack and fresh. Much enjoyed.
Almond tea cake was greasy.

Tried the breakfast sandwich on a baguette, rather than the typical croissant and loved it!
Now I prefer the baguette!  It was lightly toasted, crispy and actually easy to bite into. Substantial and delicious ....and love that you can choose your cheese and other additions.
Dessert and espresso was phenomenal and sitting out on the front patio was very peaceful.

Quirky and fun coffee in a strip mal with Fresh Foods.

Friendly service, lots of bakery and food options, just not really that French. However, still a good place to hang out with friends, currently only outside (April 2021).
Great food and atmosphere. No inside seating yet, but plenty of room outdoor

Three of us went there for lunch.  Crustless quiche was not great, and way overpriced for a very small portion of mostly egg and very little else. Salad was okay,with a tasty homemade dressing.  Asparagus leek soup was very tasty.   Coffee was very good, and bakery items were excellent, but a little pricey.  Staff was helpful and friendly.
Amazing. Fig, bacon and brie...yummy! Also, the chai latte +espresso is heavenly.
Love their desserts! I had their mini-tarts and a cappuccino. Mmm! And they have outdoor seating so you can enjoy it fresh.
Good service, not the best baskery.
Love this place. Treats and drinks are amazing

Without a doubt, pre-pandemic, this place must have been amazing, a go-to place for locals. Love the mini tarts. Great selection of pastries, even late afternoon. Not sure if this is typical, but the employees seemed slightly disaffected or sarcastic. Not sure why. I visited a couple of hours before closing, and the place didn't seem very busy. Still, definitely looking forward to go again.
Delish French bakery, decor, friendly and courteous service, seating available outdoors.
So so yummy. Not as sweet as it looks. I was hesitant but so glad that I bought it. It was perfect. Someone standing in line recommended this to me. Thanks Amelie's
Very good quality, but higher prices. A little lower would be much better, so I'll only visit every now and then.
Pense que. Tenia. Mas variedad dulces

Awesome bakery! I really liked the atmosphere. Friendly staff. Great treats and wonderful coffee. We had the macaroons, fruit tart, vanilla eclair and the raspberry lemon tart, cappuccino, and mocha. Great bakery! We will be back.
I ordered a chai latte, but I think I was given an espresso with milk. Very bitter drink. Delicious pastries.
Service has taken a real dive.  Took almost 30 min to get a premade quiche and breakfast sandwiches and 15 min for a cappuccino.  Still no inside seating available
Delicious food and great service too!

I miss the large carafe of coffee, seems it's not offered anymore. The fresh brew, lattes, and mochas are enjoyable. Mochas are darker like European versions rather than the typical sweeter American style  The real stars are the fresh pastries. Amelie's reminded me why people like macarons (small, colorful French cookie in multiple flavor options) since regular store-bought options are dry and bland. These are fresh and delicious! I also love their coconut macaroons... try both! Unlike the Uptown site, though, the staff wasn't especially friendly today. They also didn't ask light roast vs dark roast and didn't offer cream or sweetener, requiring another wait in the line. They weren't rude, exactly, just distracted I guess. I assume it was just the day since Uptown staff was regularly positive and friendly. Coffee and food were great as usual though.

At 4:40pm the Food was I ordered was not right taste and people work was so mean that exactly place. I don't feel very respect!!!! Never go that place again anymore. I prefer other place the Amelie's was polite manners and perfect order was taste so good!! You will lose the customers because the employee!!!!!!

This is always our go-to for an afterschool treat.
Amelie's at all their locations are amazing.
The Amelies bakery follow all CDC guidelines. No dining in at this time. Floor markers in place also directing customers which door to exit out. I enjoy my short visit.

French bakery that has an airy  decadence of pastries you can't find anywhere else here in Charlotte. Clean, covid compliant and absolutely stunning desserts and coffee. I bought alot but I ate them all before I realized I didn't take pictures! That's how good everything looks and tastes there.
I love this place
Haven't been in a while, but they have amazing sweets and treats.
Food is great here
